statements.name: PROC HPFEVENTS
statements.description: The HPFEVENTS procedure provides a way to create and manage events associated with time series for the purpose of analysis. The procedure can create events, read events from an events data set, write events to an events data set, and create dummy variables based on those events if date information is provided.

arguments.name: DATA=
arguments.description: Names the SAS data set that contains the variables used in the VAR, ID, and BY statements.

arguments.name: LEAD=
arguments.description: Specifies the number of periods to extend the dummy variable beyond the time series. The default is LEAD=0.

arguments.name: MAXERROR=
arguments.description: Limits the number of warning and error messages produced during the execution of the procedure to the specified value. The default is MAXERROR=25. This option is particularly useful in BY-group processing, where it can be used to suppress the recurring messages.

arguments.name: SORTNAMES
arguments.description: Specifies that the events and variables in the output data sets be printed in alphabetical order.

statements.name: BY
statements.description: A BY statement can be used with PROC HPFEVENTS to obtain separate dummy variable definitions for groups of observations defined by the BY variables.

arguments.name: DESCENDING
arguments.description: Specifies that the observations are sorted in descending order by the variable that immediately follows the word DESCENDING in the BY statement.

arguments.name: NOTSORTED
arguments.description: Specifies that observations are not necessarily sorted in alphabetic or numeric order.

statements.name: EVENTCOMB
statements.description: An EVENTCOMB statement can be used with PROC HPFEVENTS to create a new event from one or more events that have previously been defined.

arguments.name: LABEL=
arguments.description: Specifies a label for the dummy variable for this event. 'SAS-label' is a quoted text string of up to 256 characters. The default label is 'Dummy Variable for Event <variable-name>,' where <variable-name> is the name specified in the EVENT statement.

arguments.name: RULE=
arguments.description: Specifies the action to take when combining events.
arguments.help: RULE=ADD | MAX | MIN | MINNZ | MINMAG | MULT*value*

arguments.name: ADD
arguments.description: Add the values

arguments.name: MAX
arguments.description: Use the maximum value

arguments.name: MIN
arguments.description: Use the minimum value

arguments.name: MINNZ
arguments.description: Use the minimum nonzero value

arguments.name: MINMAG
arguments.description: Use the value whose magnitude is the least

arguments.name: MULT
arguments.description: Multiply the values

statements.name: EVENTDATA
statements.description: An EVENTDATA statement can be used with PROC HPFEVENTS to input events from an events data set and to output events to an events data set.

arguments.name: CONDENSE
arguments.description: Specifies that the EVENTDATA OUT= data set be condensed; any variables that contain only default values are omitted from the data set. The EVENTDATA IN= option reads both condensed data sets and data sets that have not been condensed.

arguments.name: IN=
arguments.description: Names an input data set that contains event definitions to be used in the PROC HPFEVENTS procedure.

arguments.name: OUT=
arguments.description: Names the output data set to contain the event definitions as specified in the EVENTDATA IN= data sets and the EVENTDEF, EVENTKEY, and EVENTCOMB statements. The OUT= data set can then be used in other SAS procedures to define events.

statements.name: EVENTDEF
statements.description: The EVENTDEF statement defines an event that can be included in forecasting models. The following options can be used with the EVENTDEF statement.

arguments.name: AFTER=
arguments.description: Specifies options that control the event definition after the timing value. The DURATION= and SLOPE= suboptions are used within the parentheses in the AFTER=( ) option. See the BEFORE= option for information about the DURATION= and SLOPE= suboptions.

arguments.name: BEFORE=
arguments.description: Specifies options that control the event definition before the timing value. The DURATION= and SLOPE= options are used within the parentheses in the BEFORE=( ) option. DURATION=number specifies the event duration before the timing value when used in the BEFORE=( ) option or after the timing value when used in the AFTER=( ) option. SLOPE=GROWTH | DECAY specifies whether a ramp or temporary change type is growth or decay. The SLOPE= value in the BEFORE= option controls the slope before the timing value and the SLOPE= value in the AFTER= option controls the slope after the timing value. SLOPE= is ignored unless TYPE=RAMP, TYPE=TR, TYPE=TEMPRAMP, or TYPE=TC. SLOPE= is also ignored if the corresponding DURATION=0.

arguments.name: LABEL=
arguments.description: Specifies a label for the dummy variable for this event. 'SAS-label' is a quoted text string of up to 256 characters. The default label is 'Dummy Variable for Event <variable-name>,' where <variable-name> is the name specified in the EVENT statement.

arguments.name: PERIOD=
arguments.description: Specifies the interval for the frequency of the event.

arguments.name: PULSE=
arguments.description: Specifies the interval to be used with the DURATION= option to determine the width of the event. The default pulse is one observation.

arguments.name: RULE=
arguments.description: Specifies the action to take when the defined event has multiple timing values that overlap.
arguments.help: RULE=ADD | MAX | MIN | MINNZ | MINMAG | MULT*value*

arguments.name: ADD
arguments.description: Add the values

arguments.name: MAX
arguments.description: Use the maximum value

arguments.name: MIN
arguments.description: Use the minimum value

arguments.name: MINNZ
arguments.description: Use the minimum nonzero value

arguments.name: MINMAG
arguments.description: Use the value whose magnitude is the least

arguments.name: MULT
arguments.description: Multiply the values

arguments.name: SHIFT=
arguments.description: Specifies the number of pulses to shift the timing value.

arguments.name: TCPARM=
arguments.description: Specifies a parameter used in the growth/decay equation for TYPE=TC.

arguments.name: TYPE=
arguments.description: Specifies the type of event variable.

arguments.name: VALUE=
arguments.description: Specifies the event indicator value.

statements.name: EVENTDUMMY
statements.description: An EVENTDUMMY statement can be used with PROC HPFEVENTS to output dummy variables for events to a data set. The OUT= option must be specified.

arguments.name: OUT=
arguments.description: Names the output data set to contain the dummy variables for the specified events based on the ID information as specified in the ID statement.

statements.name: EVENTGROUP
statements.description: An EVENTGROUP statement can be used with PROC HPFEVENTS to create an event group or make a predefined event group available for processing. The EVENTGROUP statement constructs a SAS complex event. A complex event is an event that is represented by multiple dummy variables.

arguments.name: LABEL=
arguments.description: Specifies a description stored in the EVENTDATA OUT= data set. If no label is specified, then "." is displayed in the EVENTDATA OUT= data set.

statements.name: EVENTKEY
statements.description: An EVENTKEY statement can be used to alter a user-defined simple event or a predefined SAS event or to create a new event.

statements.name: ID
statements.description: The ID statement names a numeric variable that identifies observations in the input and output data sets. The ID variable’s values are assumed to be SAS date, time, or datetime values.

arguments.name: ALIGN=
arguments.description: Controls the alignment of SAS dates used to identify output observations.

arguments.name: BEGINNING
arguments.description: Beginning

arguments.name: MIDDLE
arguments.description: Middle

arguments.name: ENDING
arguments.description: End

arguments.name: END=
arguments.description: Specifies a SAS date, datetime, or time value that represents the end of the data.

arguments.name: FORMAT=
arguments.description: Specifies the SAS format for the time ID values.

arguments.name: INTERVAL=
arguments.description: Specifies the frequency of the input time series.

arguments.name: SETMISSING=
arguments.description: Specifies how missing values are assigned in the time series that is copied to the dummy variable data set when no observation matches the time ID in the input data set.

arguments.name: MISSING
arguments.description: Missing values are set to missing. This is the default option.

arguments.name: SKIP
arguments.description: If the observation for the time ID value is missing in the input data set, then the corresponding observation is skipped in the dummy variable data set.

arguments.name: START=
arguments.description: Specifies a SAS date, datetime, or time value that represents the beginning of the data.

statements.name: VAR
statements.description: A VAR statement can be used with PROC HPFEVENTS to copy input variables to the output dummy variables data set.
